Ready or Not is certainly in a strange place. I know I haven't played the game all that much, but I'm gonna go off of what I have seen a lot of people talk about, with some of my own opinions/experiences sprinkled in.

THE GOOD:

RoN has INCREDIBLE gunplay. Every gun feels like it packs a punch, and shooting them feels incredibly satisfying.

The loadout customization is top notch. RoN has many guns, ranging from shotguns, to submachine guns, to rifles, and with some less lethal guns sprinkled in there as well, alongside your pistol sidearms. Every gun has lots of attachments and other goodies, so you can get that perfect loadout. Alongside the guns, you can equip many different tactical gear items that do all sorts of things. There are also lots of cosmetic items for you to equip as you unlock them.

RoN has incredible attention to detail. Every map has lots of hidden details and lore in them, connecting every map to each other in a cool little story ark. You could spend hours looking through every map, trying to find the details that paint the full picture.

RoN supports modding. Need I say more?

THE MEH:

RoN has very little progression. Everything in your loadout is available from the moment you launch the game (excluding cosmetics). The only visible progression is by unlocking maps and cosmetics as you complete missions.

Friendly AI is... decent. The cop AI can recieve many commands and clear areas for you, which makes them a very useful tool. However, they often get in the way (especially when navigating tight spaces) and refuse to move. Alongside that, there are several bugs that range from funny cosmetic glitches to game breaking.

THE BAD:

This game's optimization is GARBAGE. It is impossible to overstate how poorly this game is optimized. The best computers will be brought to their knees just trying to load the menu. If you don't have a semi beefy computer, don't bother buying this game until it gets significantly better optimization. 

The suspect AI is cracked. As in, on crack. Suspect AI has perfect vision, aim, and tracking. It makes clearing some areas nearly impossible, because you'll be getting shot from 5 different places at once and cannot hide behind cover because the suspects will just shoot through the wall directly into your head. Plus, it is next to impossible to get a suspect to surrender without putting bullet holes in them, so good luck trying to get any of the "arrest x suspect(s)" objectives.

Many of RoN's maps are huge. Maps that take less than 30 minutes to properly clear are incredibly rare. A side effect of this is that it becomes incredibly frustrating to play the game when you die 45 minutes into a map because the suspect AI shot you from three stories up and was impossible to see.

SUMMARY:

If you have $50 to burn and have a beefy computer, I'd say go for it. But, if you don't, wait. Wait for the game to go on sale, and for the game to receive many more updates. The game right now is in such a precarious state.
Honestly, the game is just fun and sure the friendly AI are sometimes obnoxious, but I can say I've never experienced the enemy seeming as if they are too powerful.

Revised Review from Early Access

As I bought this game from Early Access and the Supporter Edition, and now I keep continuing to play this game, here are my feedback for 1.0 update.

Positive
- Gameplay (The gunplay is amazing)
- Customization of your loadout (Weapons, Attachments, and Outfit)
- New weapons
- New maps (some maps have 2-3 different entry points)
- Features a portable tablet which you can check the details of map's objective, the profiles of the suspects and civilians, and the 911 audio calls.
- Improved SWAT AI (although sometimes it is janky)
- Graphics

Negative
- The game is unoptimized
- Removed game modes for all maps.
- Suspect AI is even worse. They have aimbot, tracking, wallhacking, John Wick, and going suicidal approach to engage with players as if they have no qualms in their lives. This was already existing back in Early access days.
- Rules of Engagement (RoE) is sometimes wonky. Also the RoE is strict especially in a terrorist or active shooter maps.

I would really like to recommend this game. However, in my opinion, the 1.0 update feels like it was rushed. The developers should have delayed and tested it properly ESPECIALLY the Suspect AI and the optimization of the game. This is 0.5 disguised as 1.0.

This isn't your average first person shooter. It's not about "mowing down" enemies and getting the highest number of kills. It isn't about progression, grind or getting upgrades for your guns so you can "shoot" better. Ready or Not approaches game play from a pure cooperative mindset. Your team is the main asset, not the individual player, and all of your efforts as a team determine whether you can complete a mission.

What Ready or Not offers that other games don't is the challenge of completing a mission without making a single mistake, or completing it with the least amount of mistakes possible. It's about coming up with a strategy, executing it and reflecting on what has and hasn't worked. I'm lucky that I have a good team, where we constantly talk about how we execute missions and how we can do things better. When we fail missions we examine our loadouts, our strategy and pacing, and react accordingly. With trial and error and using different combinations, we've managed to create a somewhat versatile team that can respond to a variety of scenarios. For example, during hostage rescue missions, we employed the use of lethal and non lethal firearms, riot shields and door wedges to lock and secure hostages indoors to keep them safe. We give assailants the chance to surrender by using non lethal firearms first, and when they choose to engage we take them down. With bomb threats, we equipped breaching shotguns, SMGs and light armor to quickly access areas and prioritize the bombs. 

And this is where the game falls short. It is impossible to achieve this if you are playing with randoms, and I'm not saying that you won't find good random players, but this game is best played when you have a team of dedicated people that are willing to learn the game with you as you go. 

There are some areas in the game that could be improved, mainly the AI for me. They do react in a strange way sometimes but that can be fixed in the future. After the last update in January, I did witness a massive improvement when compared to the earlier build. With more maps I think this game will be something unique that many will appreciate. 

If you have a team of 4 players, I highly recommend you get this game and experience it yourself. 


Edit: After nearly 2 years from early access, the game still suffers from a lot of bugs. New release still feels like early access and sometimes even worse.

So I had some hesitation before buying this game because often I dont have friends to play with and I'm not that great at games like Rainbow Six Siege which I had heard this game was like. So I actually purchased Six Days in Fallujah first. I found the gunplay in that game to be rough and clunky somewhere between Arma/Squad and it had no solid single player options. So i refunded and paid the difference to try this game out. Boy am I glad I did.

You play as a Swat Commander, a leader of a 5 man team, and you battle against the chaotic criminal element of fictional Los Suenos to save innocent lives and stop bad guys, with lethal force if necessary. In single player you command four AI SWAT team members with a wide range of commandsfrom wedging doors shut to restraining enemies to breaching and clearing rooms with difference devices and weaponry in hundreds of potentials combinations of easily accessed andused commands. Commanding the AI team members feels very smooth and easy to do while you work alongside them to stop the bad guys which i really liked. It's so accessible and intuitive and was very easy to get used to doing.

In multiplayer You and up to four other players work together to complete the missions and while real world tactics and stealthy cautious play is highly rewarding, you can just as easily chuck four flashbangs or shot gun a door down and run in blasting.

The gun play in incredible. It's the best feeling gunplay ive ever seen in a game. The recoil feels real: It's there but controllable, the weapons move incredibly realistically, and they sound incredible. Movement with your weapon aimed down sight feels like watching a helmet or gun angle from a hollywood block buster. 

Speaking of guns there are dozens of rifles, submachine guns, shotguns, pistols, weapon accessories, less-lethals and explosives, gadgets and devices, armortypes, and clothing and gear appearances to choose from giving you literally thousands of possible combinations to choose from. Just a few out fits i like to be kitted out in are all black classic swat apparel, button down and jeans with hiking shoes like i just responded off duty to call, or straight boogaloo time with a hawaiian shirt, gold rimmed morpheus shades, and a big fat sparkling diamond studded watch with my AK variant.

You can also customized the load out of each of your individual guys(alpha, bravo, charlie, delta) and they are separated into two smaller commandable teams of blue and red. I like to qeue up orders to have mytwo man fire teams breach two different doors simultaneously and give myfirst-man-in a ballistic shield with pistol and the second man a high powered rifle or semi autoshotgun to stop threats from behind the firstmans shield. Or i cna run them four strong (five including me) and have them absolutely dominate a room together.

A cool thing too is this game isnt just about killing all the bad guys. While you CAN do that, you are graded for your performance at the end of each mission and you get a better score if you can take more bad guys alive. So that means using less lethals to break enemy morale and force them to surrender so you can safely cuff them. You can also tap the F key and your swat guy will yell at suspects to get down and surrender and when your whole team is firing at an enemy position yelling at them that can make them surrender and give up without dying.

Your Ai team mates also have indivdual skills like "negotiator" which makes it more likely enemies will surrender when yelled at, or door kickerwhich makes it more likelyyour team will kick a door down in one kick, or"moral officer" whihc makes it less likely your teams stress will build up. Which is another thing! In the campaign you have to manage your guys stress. After a mission they may be ancious, stressed, or having a crisis. If these things arent addressed they can break down mid mission or quit your team and have to be replaced, or be forced into therapy and un usable for 2 or 3 missions. Taking suspects alive,  avoiding injuries and deaths on your team, and keeping the active members of your team content all contribute.

This game is a mazing and easily the best 50 bucks Ive spent in years! Don't wait! Los Suenos needs you! Roll up!

That needs to be corrected. And maybe in the future add a bit more customization options for the outfits and weapons alike.
Also I can't wait to see what you guys do with the PvP. Good luck! Amazing job!

This is where I think Steam should have a Neutral review option. While the game itself is fairly deep and quite fun, with the many options available to complete your missions, some things make me unable to truly recommend this game.

Other than the enemy AI being a bit overtuned, which is resolved by mods and is getting officially addressed in the next few patches, a general lack of polish makes it hard to justify its asking price.
The AI generated textures for artwork featured in maps and briefings feel very cheap and amateurish and take away from the worldbuilding and immersion.
The speech-to-text subtitles have not been proofread and as a non-native english speaker I would have found them useful to understand some technical and tactical lingo, but as is they're unusable.
I could be wrong on this but some maps' furniture appears to have strange hitboxes.

That being said the sound work is fantastic and the mechanics are great. The atmosphere is conveyed well to the player and some missions really gave me the creeps for the first few playthroughs.

In conclusion, great game but the 50€ full price is too high for the quality currently provided. I had paid the earlier lower Early Access price of 27€ and that seems like a fairer deal. Either wait for a unlikely sale or a improvement in polish and balance.

As someone who was apart of the Supporter Edition from the very early beta versions of the game, who's S ranked every mission in the game on 1.0, I cannot recommend this game in its current state. If you want to go through and shoot everything in sight, it's a fairly fun shooter, but as a tactical police shooter taking inspiration from SWAT, it falls very short.

[h1]Biggest Issue[/h1]
The biggest issue currently is that Suspect AI have no variety what so ever and are extremely accurate and aggressive. They all act very similarly, whether they're a drug addict in their crack den, a homicidal maniac barricaded in his home, or straight up terrorists shooting everyone in sight. A meme among the community is that every mission in this game makes you feel like you're assaulting Osama Bin Laden's compound, and that's not very far off. They constantly fake surrender with 5 guns pointed at their head. They constantly rush past corners and into open areas, despite knowing you're there. They constantly resist non-lethal or even lethal shots until you spam F. The root of this issue is the suspect AI are currently programmed to be very aggressive and offensively mind-set, even on defensive maps like barricaded suspects, with very little difference among them, leading to a game-play experience that is extremely predictable.

[h1]Repetitive Missions[/h1]
And because there is very little difference in the suspect AI, the missions become the same thing, over and over again. You're most likely going to be shooting 80% of the suspects you encounter, no matter what kind they are, and the game gets very repetitive after you've completed Commander Mode. A prime example of this disconnection is the streamer den mission. VOID advertised this mission as going into a streamer's home who has been swatted, with a false 911 call about him shooting his mother to death and taking his brother hostage. This mission could of been this game's Fairfax Residence, with very little suspects at all, just civilians falsely accused of a crime who have no idea you are there, who may be armed or not, perhaps falsely believing their home is being invaded.

Instead, VOID decided to make it another fucking trip into Fallujah. Why are there 10+ gangsters in this mission with automatic weapons and shotguns? I understand there's some kind of illegal server farm (which has people walking around with guns as if they're constantly expecting the cops???), but why are these people in the streamer's room and in the hallways? I don't really care if there's a reason for it, it just speaks again to this game's issue of having stale, repetitive missions and how much missed opportunity there was. Clearly, VOID was afraid that a slow paced tactical shooter wouldn’t be liked by mainstream audiences, and that’s why most missions feel like a shooting gallery.

[h1]The "S" Rank Hell and ROE[/h1]
The ROE for these missions are pretty dumb, with S rank always requiring you to bring every single suspect in alive, which basically requires you to spam beanbag shotguns, gas, and F compliance yell until your fingers hurt. Why do I need to bring in actual Jihad terrorists or school shooters in alive to get an S rank? For missions where the suspects are defensive, I can understand that mentality, but for missions where lives are at risk or the suspects have offensively assaulted a location, why would any police department have that kind of ROE? They wouldn't.

[h1]John Wick Suspects[/h1]
If you don't install an AI mod like I had to do, be prepared to deal with AI who can snap shoot you through walls. The way the devs programmed it is that if you fall within a certain "visual cone" within 500 meters, the suspects immediately identify and turn towards you with a 0.1 (yes, that's actually how it's programmed) reaction time. Because of this, they can spot you through the smallest holes in geometry, which usually results in you getting shot through walls randomly whilst walking through open areas. The most infamous example of this is the postal office warehouse.

[h1]Lot of Needed Improvements[/h1]
There's also a lot of other issues currently which makes the game seem half-baked. Lack of QoA (can't save outfits in customization, no gun stats), lackluster story, god awful optimization (I have a 4090 and the game still runs like shit sometimes),  VOID clearly rushed this release to capitalize on the holidays, and it's hilariously sad to see how it has backfired on them, going from 40k daily players back down to what it used to be around 15-10k.

For those unaware about the history in recent years with VOID, they've mishandled this game. They rarely had updates in early access, despite making 2 million dollars off of it, and most likely more off this recent release which I hope they put towards improving and fixing the game, instead of a rumor which I will go into down below. VOID is a small company, so I can understand that things take time, but this release in particular came out of nowhere. It really did feel like they got our hopes up, trying to market the game as finished, when in reality it wasn't and they just wanted to grab as much money as possible off of the holiday rush.

There's talk that VOID has begun preparing to abandon this project in favor for a new one. All I can say is if they do that, they aren't getting a penny from me in the future, and I encourage you to do so the same. It's a real shame to see a project you were invested in turn to such a wet fart.

Ready or Not is a great idea executed badly. Instead of cutscenes, the game tells its narrative through context and environmental storytelling. It's quite a barebones narrative, but I found it satisfying enough to get 80% of the way through. I wish I could stay and sing its praises, but I can't. I don't recommend this to anyone, under any context.

What drove me away was the SWAT AI. They can't see you, and will constantly walk into you. They'll push you out of cover during firefights, and will shoot (and kill) you if you're ever between them and a suspect. If you clear a small room, they'll block the door and not move even if they're attacked by suspects. 

The suspect AI are basically TF2/CS:GO bots. They don't behave like people, running around and attacking you if they see you. They're not difficult to defeat, but it's sad when the game hypes up your confrontation with Amos Voll and then Amos Voll turns out to be another CS:GO terrorist(he even looks like one!) with a P90 who doesn't even have voice lines.

Ready or Not is a highly intense and interactive game with many different ways to play. It can be mentally fatiguing as you are in charge of your swat team. Each door or hall way could lead to you or your team dying. This game can be pretty difficult to get used because of the incredible detail it has in store which really is not a bad thing. The game is even better with you're own team of friends.

With all that being said the game does have some things that are hard to deal with such as team members stress levels are hard to deal with. After each mission your team will have a stress level and if it is too bad then you will have to send them to therapy and use other guys in their place. This game was not made to support controller so me as a controller user that brings its own difficulties but i understand that with all of these controls it could be very difficult to cram them into so few buttons. Luckily you can change your settings as you see fit. Also the loading times and the game lagging out while online needs to be fixed or atleast worked on. 

All that to say that i really enjoy this game and recommend it to everyone. Rating it at a nice 8.8.
Tip: Download on your SSD and not your HDD if possible. It helps load times.

I know my time within the game doesn't really stand up against most others, but I think this may be one of the best sleeper hits of the 2020s so far. And I use the term "sleeper hit" very lightly, as this game, while having a fairly decent sized community, will probably end up being outshined at some point. However, I think this game will be the father of the modern generation of FPS tactical shooters that AREN'T a PvP slog. 

If you're coming into this expecting a fun COD jaunt, leave. This game won't be for you, and I don't intend to sound mean saying that, but you won't be able to win just by flying through rooms shooting everything that moves, as you have to keep an eye on civilians, who's faking dead and who's actually dead, terrorists trying to blend in with civilians, and a variety of other random scenarios that seem to be implemented really well so far. 

I recently came back as I saw the game finally released in 1.0, and so far from the almost hour and a half I've played of it, I think they devs have truly outdone themselves. When I played this when it was still in EA, I had my hesitation, thinking they would just cave and turn it into a Tarkov-like, but I couldn't have been more wrong. 

The game, while suffering from frame drops in certain rooms with a ton of effects, still looks and feels good. I've experienced only one crash so far. You also have to remember that VOID Interactive is a team of less than 50 people who have managed to, in my opinion, blow most AAA FPS games out of the water (I'm looking at you Modern Warfare 3.) Hopefully, with a few more updates, this game will be in perfect playing condition.  

I think it's funny that so many people are currently complaining about the "aimbot AI" because, if anything, it makes the game feel much more realistic and punishes people who aren't being careful about their next steps and making good calls. You have to think that maybe they programmed the AI to be better, faster, and more responsive to what's going on because in the same real situation, the criminals might have had time to learn the layout of the building and secure potential weakspots. They had time to figure out their strategy whereas you have to make yours up on the fly. Just like if something went belly-up for a real life SWAT team. 
Sure, it's not fair, but do you think SWAT operators are put into fair situations?

Overall, outside of a few small issues that don't really make the game unplayable, I think this is a fun, realistic way to put yourself into the boots of a SWAT team commander.

I'll be putting in some pros and cons for this one

Pros: 

- The Guns all feel and act differently. Each weapon in this game is unique despite their similar appearance.
- Breaching is strategic and fun
- Animations are superb. Limbs fly off enemies scream in pain and bleed-out if not attended too.
- Objectives are similar but enemy placement and different strategies used by A.I makes each encounter feel different. 
- Scores affect your characters cosmetics. Higher scores equal fun cosmetic unlocks.

Cons:

- The A.I Is a bit broken in this game. Regardless if you attempt a stealth approach enemies can somehow see you through walls and even have god like eco location
- The game stutters horribly. I wish this wasn't a problem, however I have seen multiple stutters happen in this game. Tried to limit fps, lower graphic settings and stutters still happen.
- The hardest mode doesn't really feel like it affects the player that much

Overall Ready Or Not Is a fun experience for those wanting something different. However in the games state that it is now I certainly hope they patch a lot of the buggy issues with it. Not bad but really needs some fixes.

I have a longer list of reasons why you might enjoy this game than i do not, however some of the reasons i dont like this game are too big to ignore and just have fun otherwise. So here some of them are:

~If you fail a mission there is no quick restart. You have to load through the entire post mission screen, load HQ, re select the mission by walking to it, wait 10 seconds, load up the mission again  only to possibly get smoked 30 seconds in because you weren't aware of trip wires being on that particular door or something. I understand them wanting us to take a tactical slow approach and penalize us for failing but this is NOT the way to do it. Lazy and makes me rather just not go through the load times and play something else.

~There are massive FPS spikes for no reason. I have a top tier PC and sometimes the game goes from 90 fps - 40 or even 20. From all my research this is due to the games latest versions being completely unstable.  In my first Ides of March run where i actually thought i was going to beat it my frames dropped all the way to 15 and i ended up getting killed SO ANNOYING because this mission is difficult anyway doesnt help that the devs unstable build causes more pain. 

~An issue maybe more personal to me and not experienced by everyone else is i cant join my friends with mods. It always gives an error even tho we disable server side check sum, but i can join random online lobbies no problem.  

These are the 3 biggest issues, top 2 being most relevant to everyone else. I also really hate that they have sniper scopes with "variable zoom" but theres no keybindings for the variable zoom so theyre all 1x scopes... seems like it couldve been something pretty ez to add to 1.0 imo. 

Id recommend to wait till the game is in a better state or buy it when its atleast 40% off!

a very good tactical shooter with easy to learn but hard to master mechanics. the guns and gear and general aesthetic was done extremely well, as well the detailed maps add story and world building if you take the time to pay attention to it. the level design also allows players to approach problems from various angles to varying degrees of success. multiplayer is very fun with the right people and is very rewarding. the controls are intuitive but the team commands for single player can be a bit clunky at times, and the enemy AI can at times be a bit too quick and accurate to be fair. but aside from that the game is very fun and i'm sure to sink more hours into it later.

I really wanna like this game but i cant. I love this kind of stuff, but this is so unfair and ridiculously hard. You have all these tools at your disposal yet they seem to do nothing in the face of Aimbot AI. If you are spotted, basically at all by an enemy that has a gun, you will die or immediately injured to the brink of death. Yes, i am fully aware this trying to be as life like as possible and they are tense situations, but humans dont have AIMBOT! The AI is literally the only thing bringing this game down for me right. Im not a game devloper so i have no way of knowing how to tweak this to make it better but as it stands its so infuriating to instantly die, load back to the station after a minute. slowly walk back to the mission table, select mission, ready up, wait ten seconds, wait another ten seconds. Go back in, only to die again trying to peek a door with an enemy facing the other way and turning to do the famous 360 no scope on you. 

Devlopers you guys truly did do a good job at this game. So many life like reactions from your AI team, the code words, weapons and feeling of being in SWAT (i am not that in real life) But at the end of the day. This is a game, not reality. IF you make a game so realistic its bordering un-fun, bang your head against the wall slogs than tweaking may need to be looked at.

To those that may say "Well why dont you use your AI team mates" I do. While they are busy clearing a room i asked them to do, im keeping an eye on the back. They are so efficient that if i just rely on them to do everything, then whats the point of playing the game when the game can just play itself?  There is some game balance tweaks that need to be looked out i think before this game is truly good. As it stands its great, but im giving it a thumbs down for slit my own throat difficutly.

I never give thumbs down for any product that I buy because if I don't like it, maybe others might like it. This is my only exception, as this is one of those immersive, tacticool, muh-realism games.

The average human being has a reaction time of 250 milliseconds. The AI has a reaction time of 200 milliseconds with near perfect aim. They will react with impunity, despite being being shot, or theoretically dazed by whatever options you dish out. Moreover, they will always land near perfect shots and even *WALLBANG* you. 

Some other unrealistic scenarios would include thin and waifish female cult-members perfectly handling an SA58 with perfect recoil control on full auto. While I expect extremists to maybe be trained with firearms, I also don't expect fragile flowers to be proficient in firearms like Solid Snake. 

Ally AI is also worrisome but manageable, working quite well in small and relatively enclosed and predictable spaces but performing very poorly in long, unpredictable corridors. You are often babysitting your ally AI seesawing between making them clear out the room (they also have near perfect aim) and pulling them back because they're often walking into an open space that will get them killed. Takes the fun out of the game. 

It pains me to give a negative review; but it simply is unplayable after a certain point.

This game is a damn bust, it's just not that good. Despite what it says, the game may as well still be in early access. Still very buggy, still very unpolished, still very unfun. They want you to play the game slow, careful and tactical. But the AI just dissuade that playstyle, they're way too accurate, they have little to no regard for their own lives, they can see through objects sometimes and have a tendency to wallbang way, way too accurately. Trying to subdue them is an absolute waste, you need to be DIRECTLY in their line of sight with no object blocking them for them to hear you. And you need to wait for them to do something threatening in order to have permission to shoot them, but more often than not, giving them a chance to surrender ends up with them one-tapping you faster than a human can realistically react. Sometimes flashbangs and tasers have no effect on them, the latter, sure. But the former is ridiculous. And they can be kinda stupid too, for example they can fake their deaths and get up when the opportunity arises. But they get up the second you turn around, and if you collected their weapon already, they stand around like goobers waiting for you to arrest them again.

And on top of that, the performance in this game is abysmal. It gets REALLY laggy in some maps and in some rooms, it absolutely sucks and makes this game downright unplayable at times, since you need to be able to react quickly to situations.

All in all, this game's a joke. There are mods to sort of alleviate the issue, but you shouldn't have to turn to the community to fix the devs' problems.

After after five years of development: game is still hot garbage. 

The first person animations are satisfying and well-made. Finally, new content released (after a year without content updates). That's the end of compliments. 

Runs like a slideshow randomly every couple minutes even on potato settings, and somehow worse with each update while looking no better. Shoddy unreal marketplace assets are not to scale. Some of the more passable content has been removed for no reason at all. 

Most of all, devs are unable to address the biggest complaint about their game after two years in early access. Suspect AI will shoot you through multiple solid objects while strafing in full auto while your SWAT braindead teammates just bodyblocks you while telling you "Get out of my spot" and suicides to the aimbot suspects. Seriously, the wallhacks are such BS you'll get suppressed from bullets twenty rooms over that can't even penetrate that many wall. It's hilarious that they added replay mode to help advertise the game but the only content people make with it clowns on the terrible AI. What's sad is that players have made the same critiques of the enemy AI for a over a year. How many fixes to the AI in that time? Zero. 

For a PVE game the AI is worse than HL2 and singleplayer FPS  from twenty years ago. Programmers can't code anything remotely resembling something fun to play against so they just made their enemies ignore being shot, run around 180 spinning and spray you down because they know if the game is "hard" mouth breathers will gaslight themselves in to thinking there's actual "tactics" there. It's not just the AI, every mechanic (commander mode! "gore and response mechanics"! command interface! "nonlethal" lmao) is half-baked and barely works as intended if at all.  Incompetent studio ran off with over 500 million dollars while pole riders still glaze them endlessly each time they "update the game" by fixing localization files. 

Once you realize the aimbot AI is a cover for developer skill issue you'll understand a lot more about why they were so desperate to turn this game in to a garbage R6 clone until they were literally forced to stop. And Void couldn't optimize a UE4 game to the low bar of playable for full release after a year of waiting. Seriously, don't waste your time and buy something else.

First of all, i want to say that the game itself is pretty good. The concept is new and the game is fun to play. This will be a quite long review, but if you want to get a good impression of the cons and pros of buying this game then take your time reading. There are potential spoilers on guns, maps and other stuff, so if you dont want to know anything about that i´d recommend you to skip my review. I will also edit this in the future (if possible) if anything changes. Two friends of mine and i bought the supporters edidion back in early 2023, and therefore played since late alpha or early beta, i can´t remember 100%. I have to admit that since then, the game made big progress. There is 18 Maps which look pretty decent, you can tell there was put a bunch of work into the artwork/graphics. Also the Lobby is freaking awesome with lot of nice features like a locker room, a shooting range, a testing/simulation/training area, a meeting room and more stuff. The maps subdivide into diff. sizes and difficulties, but most of them are fairly big & lets call it "challenging" (extremely difficult). Second of which has following underlying reasons:

-First, Ai is waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaay too good. Not the challenging good but the unfair good. Most of the time they can shoot through walls and doors or seemingly bulletproof glass (you as Swat can´t shoot through it lol).

-Second, they tend to take a crazy amount of shots, not just from non lethal guns but also from Assault Rifles or Mp´s while you as swat even with steel plates and full body armor (strongest/best possible armor you can equip in the game)sometimes die from a few pistol shots (it gets more ridiculous than this, trust me).

I want to elaborate a little more on this point and give 2-3 good ingame examples we´ve encountered several Times in the last two weeks alone. There is a Map called Neon Tomb. Its basically a Night club occupied by terrorists. They are well equipped, hence i understand that they wont give up instantly when we shoot them with beanbags or they dont die instantly when shot in the stomach with an Mp several times. But how can it be that when one of them gave up, then pulls out his pistol, shoots me in my stomach or legs or whatever i instantly die?? I doubt that some terrorists are better equipped than fucking swat. Also, once i shot my ENTIRE Pistol mag in the Head, Neck and upper body of an attacker from 2m distance and he still survived. Like c´mon, seriously? But this alone wont be that bad. Now on another map, called Car Dealership, there are some gangsters (or at least simmilar looking) in the Workshop without ANY FKIN CLOTHING (upper Body not nude lol). Guess what, they took 7 Ak shots to the entire upper Body from round about 10m distance and were still standing. I on the other hand got 2 shottet by an AR. I get that the game wants to have high realistic standards, therefore you can´t do the John Wick and tank every bullet. BUT SO SHOULDN`T THE FUCKING ENEMIES, particularly those without ANY FUCKING ARMOR!? In some situations, the taser is more effective then a beanbag-shot. Bro the enemy has a 20cm thick armor on, long sleeves, a neck protection and a helmet. How tf is my taser able to penetrate his armor and his skin but my beanbag with 12 cal. cant do shit???

But i want to name a positive thing. They made the weapons super realistic. They behave like they would irl. The way you hold them, pull them, shooting sound, reloading, equippement (laser, rl laser, Flashlight, silencer, muzzle and much more), bullet "consumption" and recoil. A thing that bothers me tho is that on a mission, when you stand infront of a door and the enemy steps in, you hold your weapon up in the sky and cant shoot. This is to protect you from shooting a civilian or your m8´s when close to them, but Devs, PLEASE FOR THE LOVE OF GOD remove this feature when enemies are close to you because not being able to shoot fucking sux and is not realistic at all.

Now the last BIG problem with the game which is probably the most annoying one.

Me and my friends all have pretty decent computers, I do have a Nvidia 3090rtx 8gb, Intel I9 12900, 32Gb ram and windows 11 pro. My friends have similiar setups.
(Note: We all turned down the graphis to medium/low, important information for the next part!!)
When we chill in the lobby we usually have arround 150-200 fps. When we start a Mission, our fps instantly drop under 100, which itself isnt that bad. but the closer you get to the actual House/entrance/whatever, the more the fps drops. This happens on 16 of the 18 maps. Dont get me wrong, the maps are fucking beautiful. For example the (sun-)light, light reflection, shadows, houses, people, environment just everything looks so good. Even on low graphics. But how the hell is it possible that my frames tend to drop UNDER 30 FPS? Like my Setup is not that bad, i know there is better setups, obv, but man there is a lot of worse setups out there, how are the others able to play this game??? Just look on what they say on their website for recommended Components.  Its fucking ridiculous. An Intel I5 would be grilled, so would the 1060 and the Amd parts. I would bet that the game wouldnt even start the mission or you can grill some eggs and bacon after 2 minutes into the game, because even my setup (i have water cooling) gets over 90°C (about 200°F) occasionally. 

Don´t get me wrong, although all these things are terrible and annoying the game itself still makes fun, especially with friends. It´s just sad to see that the devs seem to give no fux on performance and balancing and focus more/too much on realism. I have no problem to play Neon Tomb for a couple of days every night for 3-4 hours to get it done non leathally and get the "S" on the map (definetly didn´t happen, i didnt jump from 22 hours on sunday to 47 hours today, thursday), but its the way how/why we played. It´s because there is sooooo much bugs and every try we die because of another Problem, You cant use gas for example because then enemies shoot you through it without being able to see. You can´t use shield because after getting shot once or twice the little glas is broken and you cant see anymore. You cant use c2 properly because even if the enemies stand 5 meters away from the door they die from it. You can use wedges, but ocasionally the enemies are still able to open the doors and flank you so we die. You can use Flash/stinger launcher, but ocasionally it just "looses" its mag so even if you did reload or you didnt shoot since the beginning of the mission there is no bullet inside. Also, if you die you can see the others helmet-cam, but the POV is BEHIND THE CAM ITSELF. It can´t be so hard to just eddit out the cam to make it look like we actually watch the cam, rather then seeing the whole fucking camera and the on/off button. Last thing i want to mention that the Team-cams you can use during the mission are peretty realsitic and well-made, but they also take like 10 to 20 fps, for which reason we have to stream each others view on discord so we can see what the others see.


So is it worth buying now? 100% NO! Rn there are way too many Problems that make the game A unplayable/hardly playable and B that take your fun playing the game. Is it worth buying if it is on sale or in the future? Depends on how much it costs and how much they work on it. Rn they are in their winter break but will resume work shortly. If its in sale for 20 Euro ish then yeah, i´d prolly recommend buying it and also in 4-6 Months from now they hopefully patched most of the stuff (especially the annoying things). Thanks for reading this far and if you are a dev at void interactrive, i hope you get fired for what you did with my money for supporter edition. Get your shit together man seriously!

Not ready for a 1.0 release for a variety or reasons, with the most commonly cited being true in my experience.
-Performance is spotty 
-AI have insane reaction times and accuracy for people who are, with the some exceptions, usually average people who have no firearms training. Their reaction speed and accuracy are not affected by suppressing fire or even being wounded multiple times.
-They can track you after cutting line of sight perfectly and are able to wall bang you with ease.
-Smoke and foliage offer no cover from them.
-Video of AI being crazy in demos: https://youtu.be/EiL1b3obwwI?si=XDq07LR9AkIAMe-A
-There are lots of small issues like the compass turning itself off after every single restart of a mission which is very aggravating for a game where callouts are needed.
-The new demo system cannot be turned off which is going to drain resources (a workaround is to remove write permissions to the demo folder).
-Mault IR laser obstructs iron sights on the MP9, i could understand this oversight if all attachments were available on all guns, but they aren't.
-Removal of being able to see your weapon while modifying it.

Well, full release is here, and the suspect AI is still unforgivably bad. Not incompetent bad, quite the opposite actually. They make impossibly accurate shots in impossibly short time frames, and frankly it's just not fun. Went back and played some SWAT 4 and got a breath of fresh air, the suspects actually had to take time to aim and didn't dome me through the walls. In other words, I had fun. Devs, take note, people are making youtube videos and reddit posts about the crappy AI and have been since the game came out. Nobody wants to play your game because it feels like the enemy has aimbot and wallhacks. They can see through window blinds, CS gas, dense bushes, tiny single-pixel gaps, and their reaction times are stupid. All of this compounded with their unrealistic marksmanship makes a game that is just not fun to play. I was willing to forgive this while the game was early access, but now that it's full release the cracked suspect AI cannot be tolerated.

(I have decided to change the review to positive, as I have come to realize, I wrote this while upset. Regardless, I do feel that this review does have some merit, but ultimately it is not wise to put it as not recommended despite my personal issues with it, as I truly do recommend it.)

Online, the game definitely is fun between going ham on civilians, and actually trying to play the game tactically. However, with single player, I feel that I am forced to play more tactically, which in of itself is not a bad thing. That's why I bought the game. However, with the cracked out AI that shoots you across the map because there was a box that it decided to not register as a solid object, I do not have fun, and it does not feel like intentional game design at all. 

The issues with the AI started to show this issue in the Ides of March mission when I tried to S rank it, however I simply brushed that off as them being better fortified and equipped due to their military ties. As for Greased Palms, my experience has been completely awful. Getting insta-killed from across the map, having the teammate AI decide to shoot the armed target we have to take in alive, and civilians dying in the cross fire. I have not managed to beat it a single time to the degree that it wants me to without either someone dying who needed to live, or dying myself. 

This is also not to mention the Rainbow Six inspired system of different individual officers you can hire and operate with. Though, this feature seems under-baked, and actively hinders the already infuriating single player game play. The concept is very interesting, however I feel it should be optional, as it adds basically nothing aside from the copy and paste abilities certain officers hold.

The game is **really** good for those looking for a SWAT game, though, and I've absolutely had a blast with friends. But OH. MY. GOODNESS. The AI does not seem ready for long sight lines like in Greased Palms, and until the issue of every criminal being John Wick or Chris Kyle gets addressed and solved, I do not feel I can give this a positive rating.

Game is fun if you like tactical and realistic shooters where not necesarly you will shoot a lot, and certainly not at everything.
 
- Maps are very detailed and overally well made, easy to achieve high immersion especially if you do the debrief. Some maps are hard to contain into "hallways" using doorwedges, which creates a logical challenge to make your team have safe flanks.

However. I feel like some (literally few) of the maps are WAY too big and complicated for a 5 man crew to do all the work. I found myself going all the way back my steps for one missed civillian too often to call it fun.
Sometimes the immersion is botched because of not interactive doors that a simple wheelcart was put against them. But OK at least i see clearly the boundaries of maps (except the postage center. I got lost there many times)

AI - Wow very good. enemies and civilians are sometimes hard to distingiush. Erratic movement to covers or run aways, Stubborn slow backing away almost like no guns are pointed their way. It really excercises your perception, especially if you have multiple contacts in the room. 

As for friendly TEAM AI - Awesome, in 95% of time they will be far more coordinated than any of your friends you might be playing with. their movement is smooth, thresholds are checked, suspects are dead, and civies are secured. And they look cool while doing it. 95% of time.

As for other 5% of time, some might go to different floor of freaking building because they decide it will be perfect spot to be for "stack up" command for door in the room you just cleared. If you dont notice officer go on the adventure and stop him, you will loose him to some dude with a knife.
Also whole group tend to return fire through solid walls if any of you are shot at. It creates very chaotic situation where most of the time you will die to suspect with a pistol because whole team just unleashes their whole magazines around you and therefore SUPRESSES you, and yet none of the bullet have a slightest chance to reach the threat. and you die because you cant shoot straight because screen shakes and vision gets blurry etc. Its even worse when you try to go lesslethal and they just pepper spray everything. (I heard that developers are trying to fix it so i hope that it will be treated)

Whats more?
-Guns are fun to shoot, have slick animations and every hit on target is satysfying. Altough im sick of AR platforms and there is no reason to use anything but rifles.

-The carreer mode and whole hiring and "grooming" your team officers is fun and innovative way to make you want to spare as much lifes of suspects as you can, and yet be careful in it. Loosing experienced team member is somewhat painful. And they can not only die but also resign from duty due to killing too many OR killing the suspects that they think dont deserve to die (As for example "ends of the earths" mission)

- As for said "ends of the earth" The missions, they vary from lore-filled masterpieces to axceptable scenarios. Some I accomplished on the first try, some (and sometimes because of lore i wanted to go lesslethal) I passed after more or less 30-50 tries. Seriously.

- Game is not afraid of depicting gruesome, shocking, tears inducing scenarios. question morality of people. Sometimes you will feel like you are the one who's on the wrong side.

- Great replayability due to rating score. I passed the campain as best as I could and now going for S rank on the rest. and then I will probably have some fun and then play some online etc. I have like thousand of hours on SWAT 4 so this game might just provided old sierra games masterpiece to retirement.

My biggest downside is that it doesnt feel completed. As it was announced in 2016 or 2017 it feels like 1.0 release was a little cheated. it plays and is amazing but some things are off. SWAT 4 spoiled us with expansed, detailed and very immersive voicelines. Here they are meh to OK, many more should be added. 
Many things misses their image data in the customization menu and there are many bugs in it.

Overally game kinda feels more like its release 0.95 where many things doesnt require poilishing but grinding before polishing. It does not feel like its out of late BETA. But well many AAA games that comes out recently comes out in even worse state and then is being fixed. Certainly for RoN scenario will be similiar.

And so... Very good game. If you liked SWAT 4 then you won't be dissapointed. It literally feels and plays like SWAT 5. I love it, and was waiting for such game for 18 years. and Im ashamed I didnt purchased supporters edition.
If you're a fan of a realistic swat simulator this game is for you, do recommend though if you're going to play multiplayer with friends have a full group of friends to play with

Full disclosure, I barely played SOCOM back in the day, i played mostly Call of Duty and Final Fantasy. Halo 3 ODST on XBOX then swapped to PC for Destiny 2, World of Warcraft, Diablo, Path of Exile. More recently got into Valorant and CounterStrike2.

Ready or Not's level of realism is unparalleled, in my opinion, it really shows you what it is like to be SWAT and how making any mistake can cost you your life. How hard it is to make the right decisions in intense moments and sheds light on why reality plays out the way it does.

A suspect gave up, you assume they aren't a threat, you turn your back to arrest another suspect? Well the other suspect had a gun and now you are dead. Or they had a knife and now you are dead. It really sucks you into the role you play and shows you the darkness that these people face.

I fully respect and thank the team that helped create this game and give me the ability to see into a realm I typically wouldn't be able to. This game is eye opening and also a blast to play with 4 other friends, the most fun that i can remember in a long time. 

I also thank the Law Enforcement that face the darkness in the interest of protecting us from it.

Good Coop Shooter, awful SWAT game.

Alright, the main issue I have with this game is extremely fixable; the suspect AI are ALL psychopathic cop killers who WANT to die. The way every suspect acts would be fine for terrorists, or like the "Russian mobster" guys in later levels, but it makes no sense for the majority of suspects like criminals who held up a gas station, security guards, or my favorite; random people in their own apartments. These "suspects" will:
 1. Always be armed. (And we're talking 50 round smgs first level, AKs second level)
 2. Always shoot at cops. (Do you remember suspects running away in SWAT 4? Yeah no one ever runs away in this game, they just attack you until one of you dies.) They'll literally bust down doors to attack officers they hear yelling.
 3. Never surrender from being yelled at. (And also barely ever surrender when SHOT, like legitimately they'll surrender to a beanbag gun shot, but not a real bullet.)
 4. Fake surrender like 25% of the time, just to try to kill you, and throw their life away, even when they're under gunpoint from your entire team. They'll fake dying to gunshots too.
 5. Grab hostages.
 6. Shoot through walls. (The best part is when your SWAT AI shoots back through walls and kills civilians - yes, this happens.) Special shout-out to the Private Security who will spray through cover with automatic rifles upon seeing part of your leg, and thus kill their own co-workers.

Every single suspect, from Terrorists, Mobsters, School-shooters, Cultists, Crack-heads, Gas Station robbers,  random people in their own homes, FBI AGENTS (Yes there is a target on a level who is a "FISA" agent)... they all act either exactly the same, or so similar that it really is impossible to tell the difference.

This game is a great first person shooter, and I've had a lot of fun goofing around in multiplayer, but this is supposed to be a SWAT game, and the AI just takes me out of it so much, they are so over the top bloodthirsty. Again, no problem with later levels with actual terrorists and stuff like that. SWAT 4 ends with you fighting armored, machine gun toting terrorists as well, (Ironically I think they're still less insane than regular Ready Or Not suspects) but it starts with pretty simple levels, with suspects who act more or less how they should. Level 2 in this game tells you that you're going to stop a hostage situation with ONE PERSON. Instead you fight 11 petty criminals, who, in their own apartments, with no fore-warning from the police, just walk around armed, and decide that they all want to die today.

The ridiculous part about this is that I remember the suspects actually being much more reasonable when the game first launched on steam.

I could make a whole other review going over other issues like bugs (TONS OF BUGS), the AI being stupid, the game not being particular stable, matchmaking not working well, mod.io being awful, optimization being really bad, the briefings lying, the lack of info the game gives players, bad development decisions - like remaking the same levels over and over, the recent update being a massive letdown, removing a bunch of variants for levels, removing weapons (that are still referenced in the game btw)... I wanted to focus on a more foundational issue with the game's design. All of things things can be changed, and If they would just fix the insane AI, I would recommend this game.

 If this was say... Ground Branch, the AI would be acceptable, good even, if you ignore the bugs... but this is supposed to be a SWAT game.

I notice in other reviews people saying that everyone just needs to "git gud". I want to be clear, this is not a difficulty thing. I've S ranked most of the levels including the last one, and completing all of the levels isn't hard. The AI is just so far removed from natural behavior that it completely ruins all immersion. 

OH AND THE DLC IS A LIE. ""SERVARE VITAS" - Conduct operations under the banner of the United States' most elite tactical unit, the FBI's Hostage Rescue Team, with this unique DLC. " 
I have to add this in here, because I feel that it's relevant to the scummy-ness of the devs, and because I only just became aware of it; After the newest update, they removed the "supporter edition" from steam, no warning as far as I know. and now EIGHT of the TWELVE bullet points from the DLC are either a direct lie, or haven't released yet. All of the outfits and the shield got changed to remove the FBI and HRT writing, the rifle is named differently, the gas-mask got changed for no reason, we're still missing the coyote camo uniform, the supporter test branch hasn't been used in months (which honestly I like, but still it was promised) the soundtrack has not been released, and there's ZERO information about the promised next DLC. AND YOU KNOW WHAT, THEY MADE ZERO MENTION OF THIS IN THE UPDATE NOTES!!!!!!!! CAN YOU TELL I'M PISSED? I may have my problems with the game.. but learning about this made my blood boil. You officially launch the game and make zero mention about how you just screwed over people who payed you 70 EXTRA DOLLARS.

If you want to just go massacre people in Coop this game can be fun with randoms... sometimes. It can also be extremely frustating - people dying constantly, not even trying to work together, killing everyone. 1 in 1,000 matches you'll actually get a decent team that can properly go non-lethal, and those are the best experiences.

If you want a good singleplayer SWAT game, this is not it. My recommendation would be to go get SWAT 4 on GOG (It's not on steam) and honestly also get the SWAT: Elite Force mod, it's just adds more content and fixes some bugs.

The 1.0 update was a disappointment for me and many others, inexcusable issues overshadow the actual enjoyable parts of the update. Horrible performance, and inhuman AI behavior both of which seem to have gotten worse since early access. The AI especially make you play the game less like law enforcement and more like a kill squad in police uniforms. Even the most low level suspects, like teenagers robbing a gas station have godly reaction times, and accuracy, and are all willing to die with zero hesitation 9 times out of 10. To actually complete later game levels you have two options, flash-bang, and CS everything, or shoot almost immediately after seeing a suspect. Some of the most memorable moments in SWAT 4 for me, weren't the gunfights, it was interacting with the AI in a way that felt believable, in Ready or Not most of the time the levels just turn into massive shootouts the second you enter, regardless of the scenario. To top it all off as of 1 month after launch there has been a single hot fix which didn't even address the main complaints with the game, and there has been little to no communication about what is happening or if they are even planning on fixing anything more. I really hope things change, but right now the game is not in a good place.

[h1]Basically SWAT 5[/h1]

Full release of Ready or Not is incredible, especially for the size of the dev team. Holy. 
The game is a real nice breath of fresh air in the shooter scene, something siege and the other shit hero shooters can't fill. I miss SWAT man :( and RoN will fill that role.

Sadly the launch isn't without its flaws; mainly the AI. 
It's like fighting against Al-Qaeda special operations group. These mfers have aimbot, wallhacks, 360% degree vision, MW juggernaut suits and bombs absolutely everywhere. No fucking way are a bunch of mexican border hoppers and some junkies more well equipped and better at firefights than SWAT OFFICERS. 

The AI in general will target you through Jerry's fucking mouse hole and shoot a 7.62 caliber round straight through your dome no matter the body armor or cover you have. You CANNOT combat these little fucks. They're literal Overwatch Top 500 Hanzo mains

On the contrary, your AI is batshit retarded. They're so dumb its actually questionable if their intelligence programming is supposed to be a indication to real life cops in the US. They'll get stuck on doors, shoot at walls for no reason (ALARMING THE WHOLE MAP) and also turn their backs completely on suspects they know are there, to EVIDENCE BAG A FUCKING CONDOM FILLED WITH COKE ON THE GROUND. 

Ontop of that; half of the levels have the worst lighting known to man-kind, it might even be worse than tarkov. In a game where you have to meticulously scan each room and have noticeable target acquisition finding the thug is like playing Where's Waldo but he's a crackhead with snub nosed revolver and no intentions to surrender.

But... you can kill a furry otaku pedo streamer in the game..

This is an updated review from back in September 2023. 

Ready or not is a paradoxical game. 

On one hand it provides gripping, tactical gameplay with many improvements in AI, graphics, and mission design.

Only, that's what VOID seems to think.

In reality the AI is a complete mess, the AI are not intelligent, the AI cheat, they wallbang you, they have ridiculously precise aim that only the most on the ball players can effectively deal with, regardless of the enemy. It doesn't matter if you're fighting War veterans, druggies, or security guards, they all have perfect and sometimes impossible aim, miraculously able to pinpoint your location regardless of the situation.

I should also add there's a complete lack of optimisation, even if you have a good system like I do, which is the minority, you will still run into issues. If your computer isn't beefy, then you'd best look for something else because this isn't it. 

Flashbangs do not work, the enemy will wallbang you. You cannot play Ready or Not like a normal SWAT game, because the AI will not allow you to.

The ai does not have a sense of self-preservation, they are the terminator if terminator was human, they are emotionless trigger-hungry robots.

The subtitles in the game, are not made manually, VOID took the lazy way out and AI generated the subtitles. 

VOID, honestly, is such a lazy dev team, it's beggars belief, instead of making competent AI, they take the CA route and just give it tons of cheats to mask it's ineffectiveness.
Fix AI. I don't want to fight cracked up John Wick anymore and I definitely don't want to use a mod to enjoy a game! Fire your programmers then hire them back. Most suggested solution in IT world.

I hate minorities

First off, this game is very refreshing. It is a unique take on the tactical shooter genre that fills a void in the current market. The gun play is phenomenal, as are the maps, visual story telling, and missions. 

There are some problems with the game however. The AI, can be completely cracked at times. They can see you through walls, as well as kill you with no line of sight. The game also seems to be very unstable. I have experienced frequent crashes, random frame drops in certain rooms, and enemy guns either de-spawn, or are invisible to certain players. 
Even in it's current state, the game is something special. If the developers continue to add maps, weapons, and game modes on top of tweaking the AI and fixing the bugs, this game will be legendary.

If you are looking for a hardcore, tactical swat shooter game where the goal isn't to simply destroy everything in sight, this game is for you. If you are looking for a polished shooter game, you may want to wait and see how it continues to develop. The game shows a ton of promise, but is far from 'finished' in its current state.

"Alright, listen up gamers! I've played this game for 4,567 hours, and let me tell you, it's an absolute masterpiece. The graphics? Gorgeous. The storyline? A Shakespearean epic. The characters? So real, I invited them to my sister's wedding.

Now, let's talk gameplay. It's like if Einstein and Newton had a baby, and that baby made a video game. It's that genius. The physics? I learned more playing this game than in 12 years of school. The combat system? So intense, my goldfish started sweating.

Multiplayer? Oh, you bet. I've made more friends playing this game than in real life. We're talking lifelong bonds here. The community is so welcoming, they sent me a fruit basket when I reached 1000 hours.

Now, the bugs. Oh, the glorious bugs. Each one is like a beautiful snowflake, unique and mesmerizing. They don't ruin the game; they enhance it. It's like living in a digital art exhibit.

In conclusion, would I recommend this game? Absolutely. In fact, I've legally changed my middle name to the title of the game. That's commitment. 10/10, would forget to eat and sleep again."

Is the game fun? Yeah it's fun I have fun with it. It's just super weird that the game is in the state that it's in - but the AI is still lackluster. I'll be looking forward to when it's fixed. But until then, I cant recommend the game, especially at the new 50 dollar price point and self proclaimed '1.0'. You should have waited to fix the AI.

Pretty good game. The story telling is great, the mechanics and gun handling are good, but the AI is cracked out beyond belief. If you get this game, look into the no crack for AI mod. It makes the game a lot more enjoyable since your squad wont be getting obliterated by some random suspect the instant they see you.

Update for full release: 

Game is still fun. There are more levels although it seems that the alternative game modes have been taken out for some reason, which is unfortunate. 

The swat bots are not quite as dumb as they used to be, but they still have their moments.

The enemy bots are maybe a bit better tuned, but they still will randomly go agro and shoot you 32 times through three walls and a dumpster occasionally even if you are walking and opening things softly. This ends up being the only really big frustration in the game. If you enter loud and kick things then sure they should respond by shooting through the door or wall or whatever, but this random super-bot-rage that they seem to get occasionally can ruin a slow methodical run, which is just frustrating. 

You shoot back and there's no flinch, you flash them and they don't care, the superbotrage cometh for thee. They know exactly where you are and they have perfect accuracy. 

Hopefully more tuning to come for the bots, and hopefully the additional modes will come back.

Still worth playing, although with the price increase I might be less forgiving if I had bought it now and got randomed constantly by superbotrage. So maybe pick it up on sale.

___

Game is fun but still clearly a work in progress.

Hopefully the current maps will all get every mode (bomb, hostage, etc.), and more maps would be nice, although there are already a solid group of them. The level design keeps things interesting and the attention to detail on the environments is impressive.

The enemy AI sometimes seems to go a bit nuts, somehow hearing you from several rooms away and starting to try to shoot you through a few walls. It also occasionally will prefire you through a corner or door (this happens less often if you are moving quietly, but still seems to happen sometimes). I like how the bots flank, and try to ambush you when you're cuffing someone so hopefully the devs are tuning the enemy behavior during early access to iron out the rough edges.

If you play solo expect to shoulder most of the work since your swat bots are kind of potatoes. Swat bots do okay in a heads up fight, but I have watched as an enemy approaches from behind them, and slowly, one at a time with pauses between, kills them all without them even reacting. If you point them toward a room with enemies they seem to do a bit better when they move to engage.

I got this game a very long time ago, around the time it came into early access. Now, I have some love hate with this game. A little back ground is that I play shooters from Halo to CoD to Escape from Tarkov. So I would like to think I have experiences various types of AI from adaptable AI from MGSV to bullet sponge cover seeking blitz rushers of The Division series. 

I do have background in military and see that this game does implement entering clearing buildings and managing a team size element but really its a squad since you have Alpha team and Bravo team. Anyways the game play as far as that aspect is amazing and very well handled. The uncertainty of what is on the other side, will it be a short room or a long room? Will you hook left or right? etc. not to mention using the environment to both the players advantage and AI advantage suddenly a wall that only sticks out roughly 3 feet is now your worst enemy because of lack of sight in that area.

Weapons and customization are both honestly great and not outrageous like having a magnum with a 12x scope and a pink paint on it. Simple weapon customization sight, barrel, rail system and that is all you need and you can make load-outs for your team and save certain ones. What is great is that you can Juggernaut up, go full operator, or defender of peace with pepper and bean bags its all there! As far and player and team you can not make your own officer sadly but there are few things such as shirt, helmet, gloves, pants, boots, small arm tattoos, watch, glasses/ gas mask, and kit (body armor) small things but it is something. I wouldn't mind if they get the chance to add more stuff. Doesn't need to be crazy, I don't need cat ears on my helmet. Maybe add patches? Wouldn't also hurt to add females, because why not? I mean sure you can mod the game but I rather keep mine vanilla.

Now the AI, the most controversial thing in this game that deals with violent crimes that we have seen in the real world. Yes, I can agree the AI is insane and makes the game rough to play. But, to me I feel it's a great way to keep us in check. When I first started playing this game I figured it was going to be like Rainbow Six from the early years. Manage some guys but you still get to be the hero. No, not in this game, YOU ARE A LEADER! Lead your men assist where needed that is how I've cleared most of the game in the commander mode where if and officer goes down you lose him forever if he dies and you have to monitor you team's mental state. man, oh man. This game is a masterpiece, and absolutely nothing short of it. If you're not a fan of the tactical FPS shooter genre, I wouldn't recommend it. This isn't your COD run and gun, or takes no skill kind of FPS shooter. This game is what Siege should have, and could have been. Honestly I was skeptical to throw $50 at it, but I love gambling; which is why I didn't refund it when I was very short of the 2 hour steam refund in game time and still could have.

I played the single player for about 8-9 hours and it's not bad, but compared to the multiplayer it is such a let down. I was scared to try the multiplayer, expecting myself not to be good enough; or have the comms/braincells for it. However after a few runs you'll get the hang of it, learn comms, and figure out how to truly strategize with any team. The multiplayer experience is so good I haven't been able to put this game down, its a mix of Siege and Tarkov in the greatest of ways. It'll have you on the edge of your seat no matter how many times you play a certain map or how many hours you put into the game. 

When it comes to maps and gear, this game nails it pretty well. Especially considering she's just now truly "released" and still has a ton of potential. However it could use some more of everything, more attachments, sights, maybe cosmetics, weapons (especially non lethal). Again though, she's a fresh product so I have very high expectations and look forward to an even better assembly at one point or another. 

Mods on the other hand are also super fun and unique, just like about any game there's 3rd party mods with mod launchers; or from simply importing the files. This game has its own built in mods/launcher that is extremely easy to use, and not so easy to remove (to return to Vanilla game you have to remove all mods, there is no separate launch Vanilla game feature). Since your not using a mod launcher or 3rd party mods, you have to manually uninstall all the mods imported inside the vanilla game through your games directory files and there's no way to save or bookmark them. So if you don't screenshot them or write them down, you may lose some personal favorites for a while. Overall though the mods are very enjoyable and range from zombies, to custom guns, anime girl characters + voices, new maps, visuals, and even more (no sex mod unfortunately). If your into the Tactical FPS genre like Counter Strike, Tarkov, Siege, COD, Insurgency, ARMA, or whatever floats your boat, this games an extremely realistic mixture of them all; and I highly recommend it.

Playing for 30 hours in this "wonder," I can note the following things (mostly negatives that you need to understand when purchasing this game):

1. The game is not worth its money relative to the content you get; consider buying it only at a 50% discount (as there are no interesting mechanics in the game - join, kill, try not to die from bots shooting with prefires).
There are quite a few glitches with textures. In one multiplayer session with friends, some people may see dropped weapons from criminals, while others do not. There are bugs with attached elements, like armor, which constantly detach from the model and fly off.

2. Bots are something else. Starting with allies who can get stuck in the texture of a ladder, ending with enemies. The enemies are a real horror; you can play stealthily, move carefully, change positions, but it's all useless. All bots are by default in "ready" mode, always waiting for you in the right place with a pre-aimed scope at the head, occasionally shooting with a prefire. Sometimes, bots in light body armor or even without it can survive two shotgun shots from a distance of 5-7 meters. Also, if the mission is about to end and you get killed, you can't count on your bot allies. If an enemy bot gets stuck somewhere, your comrades will just stand in place and wait, and the enemy bot won't move (tested, waited for 30 minutes, they did nothing, just stood and waited).

3. The surrendering mechanic is also terrible. Bots often shoot you before surrendering, and they don't care if you come from behind alone and threaten with a shotgun or if there are 5 people with lasers aimed at them. They might ignore you and stare at you, and after the 10th time you shout "on your knees," they might think about it, after which they may either open fire or pretend to throw their gun, then retrieve it and repeat this 2-3 times. The surrendering mechanics with a taser and pepper spray are also horrible. If you shoot a taser, be ready for the bots to not care; they might continue shooting at you or run towards other bots, ignoring the taser shots. The same applies to the pepper spray; they might start shooting or run towards other bots, and they won't care about shots aimed at their legs.

4. It's unclear how to adjust the difficulty of bots, especially in multiplayer. Therefore, if you want to run around and have fun with friends over a beer, this game is not for that. Be prepared to sweat and restart the mission 142 times per session (and you won't even be able to move far from the spawn point). I also noticed that there is some kind of ironman mode. If it's enabled by default in online mode, it explains the difficulty of the bots but doesn't justify their cheating gameplay. If something less than this difficulty level is in multiplayer, I'm afraid to imagine what the bots can do at this difficulty level, considering that regular bots kill with prefires.

5. There's no proper mission planning system where you can collectively study the plan, the estimated number of criminals, their locations, preparations, and equipment. Your maximum is a text brief with 5k characters, a map image, and a tablet with a building plan where you can put some marks, but their meaning I still don't understand. Also, in multiplayer, there's a lack of the ability to add bots. If you're playing with a friend, just the two of you in 90% of cases won't be enough, considering the bot's strength. Having the ability to add 2 bots for assistance would be an ideal solution for this.

6. Equipment and its customization also leave much to be desired, especially in weapon attachments. Why have a x1-x12 scope in close-quarters shootouts? Why not add more holographic sights and variations of reticles for them? The standard one is too bulky and obstructive. Why aren't there extended magazines, additional pouches for ammo, and various types of ammunition? Why can't you take two masks for a mission, ballistic and gas masks, for example? Or ballistic goggles, gas masks, or ballistic goggles, anti-flash goggles, gas masks? Due to these limitations, your operation must be tailored to either clearing everyone by tanking damage or gas flooding or bombarding with flashbangs.

7. Additional scenarios. While playing, you'll always wonder why the special forces, in the developers' representation, are so clumsy. Why can't you launch gas or cut off the power before entering the building? In some places, adding the ability to descend on a rope, jump/leap over obstacles, shoot from a supported position, or from cover (peeking with q/e doesn't always help because bots have aim assist and will inevitably hit you in the head) would be great. It might be more common in third-person view games, but I don't see the difficulty in adapting this mechanic.

8. Сlose combat, which is nonexistent. If you get close to a criminal, for example, with a shield, when you approach close enough, the bot will start shooting through the shield because the bot's hands will pass through it. Strikes won't bother the bot, and it will only start shooting harder, so attempting to knock it down is not worth it. If you stun an enemy, you can't do anything to them except shout to drop the weapon. While you shout and hope for their surrender, they'll just start shooting at you. There's a lack of a knife/additional taser that you can use in direct contact with an opponent. If you approach a bot with a weapon, your character will simply lower the weapon (similar to walking with space), and you won't be able to shoot while the bot can. You also cannot use anything other than a pistol while playing with a shield.

9. And lastly, the most amusing part is penalties during mission progression related to hostages and criminals. If you start shooting at an enemy who aimed at you and suddenly runs away - penalty. If you neutralize an enemy from a distance - penalty. If you strike out of anger during their prefires - penalty. If a hostage (with 5 lasers on them) doesn't kneel on the 5th demand, and you decide to hit them - penalty. If a hostage starts reaching into their pocket for a phone (as it turns out later) and begins taking pictures of you ((WHO CAME UP WITH THIS ANIMATION AND BEHAVIOR FROM THE DEVELOPERS)) and you hit them for the stupidity (better to forget about the developer of this nonsense) - penalty. This is a potential threat to an employee. In the USA, police usually shoot someone for such behavior on the street, but here the special forces during the arrest of armed criminals who shoot at them throughout the mission.

The only thing enjoyable in this game is shooting at african-american partners and the opportunity to play cooperatively without renting any servers or doing any server dance.
Dont waste your money or time
