UPDATED REVIEW: When I wrote my original review below I was an early access supporter and truly believed in the direction that the game was going. I loved SWAT 4 and its mods and truly thought that this game was a true successor to that golden classic. With the release of 1.0, I no longer hold that belief. I thought the early level design had deep storytelling, inconsistent but interesting AI, and a great tactical feel to it. I even got S rank on all the early levels before some of the latest were added so I really got to explore each level (because I died a lot). This 1.0 release felt really rushed. So many levels were completely transformed out of nowhere and many things that I thought would be ironed out (like the ridiculously unfair AI) have either been kept or made worse. I've completed the singleplayer commander mode and I just feel kinda empty. It was a real meh experience with an emphasis on flashiness and over the top shock value in level design (The back of Hokan Port is ridiculous I mean come on) rather than deep gameplay mechanics. The fact they made a giant police station acting as a really clunky and inconvenient menu (you can't restart a singleplayer level without two loading screens, a countdown, and a short walk) kinda shows me they value looks over functionality. Managing a squad feels pointless, they die all the time and the only penalty is possibly losing an acquired ability which is next to worthless. Judge, the main character, and his squad have no personality or banter other than a few lines at the end of the game. So much could have been learned from SWAT 4. Level design there had subtlety and handled sensitive topics extremely well. Your squad had good quips to really flesh each of their personalities. AI was differentiated and reacted like real people in that situation. I'm just really disappointed and it hurts to write this review. I would only recommend this game if you have friends to play with or enjoy coop with strangers. I just can't recommend the base singleplayer experience and really hope this game goes in a better direction. I'm going to stick with SWAT 4 on GOG with the Elite Force and First Responders mods.

OLD REVIEW: Even though it is currently unfinished, I can say that Ready or Not is a solid experience and truly the successor to SWAT 4 we needed. I applaud the development team for the progress they've made since this project's conception. If you enjoy tactical, slow gameplay, you will enjoy this game.

At this time, I cannot recommend this game. I have about 200 hours in the game. I have played the game for nearly 2 years now, hopping on and off every so often. Since 1.0, I’ve put in about 50 hours. I’ve completed every level on S rank. I have seen everything 1.0 has to offer, and it is not enough.

It is not nearly enough to be a “final release”. Because that’s what 1.0 is intended to be: the final working product capable of standing on its own without content updates. It is not that. The developers have not only removed content from pre-1.0 (which reduced replayability massively), they have not even finished the game. There are voice lines that are clearly placeholders, story is barely there, they used crappy AI to write their subtitles for them (“George M.” for “door jam”, “talk” for “TOC”, etc.), they generated half the images in their game with AI (hyperbole, yes, but it’s still a ridiculous amount), and they haven’t even made an enjoyable enemy experience. They kill you through walls, they’ll shoot you if they see a pixel, they’ve shot me through objects even my armor piercing rounds don’t go through, and it’s generally unfair. 

Not only that, but every AI is identical. No matter the context of the level, every AI behaves the same. There is a level where some kids were making automatic weapons to pay for their elderly parents’ medical treatment. I have seen them take their own mother, who is still in a hospital gown and recovering from some illness or surgery, hostage. I have seen terrorists shoot themselves in the head without provocation (in the replay recordings). The AI is fundamentally garbage, and all of them function identically like they’re Ex-Delta Force operatives with 500 confirmed kills regardless of if they’re a drugged up teen at a robbery, a methhead in his house, or a private military security guard. Every suspect is the same.

Levels are oversized as well. How often would a 5 man SWAT team clear a multi-floor hospital that’s been taken over by terrorists all on their own? How often would they take on a school campus with multiple active shooters and bombs on their own with 5 people? How often would a five man team be sent in to clear an entire port? 

On top of all the content and general gameplay issues, the performance is now abysmal. I have a 3080, 64 gbs of RAM, a 13600k, and this game is on an SSD. Before 1.0, this game ran perfectly. I had 0 stutters or frame drops below 144 (my cap). Now, I get 60 half the time. The other half, I get 40 or less. Something the devs did fundamentally broke the performance, and I have no idea what. Everything looks just as it did before, but now I get crap performance.

Edit: Have to add on another complaint now: Suspects and civilians will sometimes spawn in areas that cannot be reached or will cease to exist. Three times now, when I've replayed the Voll House mission with friends, suspects shot in the basement will just pop out of existence. This can softlock the game and forces you to restart the level as you cannot Bring Order to Chaos or, in some cases, the guy you're there to arrest will sometimes disappear while in there. In addition, on the post office level, Voll House, and hospital, I have had civilians spawn inside of solid objects in such a way that they cannot be arrested, preventing completion of the levels. 
The developers promised to release hotfixes throughout the first week after launch. They stopped 2 days later, on December 17th, and went on vacation. Since then, we have gotten ZERO updates from them about anything. No comments on if they're back to work (even though it's halfway through January now), let alone working on fixing or adding anything to their incomplete and broken game.

I really enjoy this game. I love role playing, real life feeling (real walking speed, no chaotic jumping) and ability to play alone or with friends. cons: When playing with friends we often experience FPS issues, even with powerful machines. Game is not optimized perfectly (yet). I’m expecting in upcoming weeks/months we might get update for this and it won’t be issue anymore.

1.0 has done more bad than good.

I'm keeping the review as a positive as the core gun-play is still the best out there, and the dev team is limited in personnel, it's just EVERYTHING around it has been messed with in some way.

Loading times are egregious, there's a mandatory 30 second wait when starting a mission (not including walking to the briefing room from the other side of the police station due to bad spawns locations, or the score count after a death which takes the same amount of time as a successful mission, or watching the squad have a little cry after their lead gets killed execution style as they couldn't be arsed to handcuff a guy you asked 3 times to cuff)
Add all that in, you can spent over a minute in loading, only to get domed 15 seconds into a mission

Suspect AI are all clones of the T-800 terminator, only way to catch them off guard is to use stealth exploits (peak door then body push it open), they hardly surrender when caught from behind they instead spinbot you, they have pinpoint accuracy in their "aware phase", they can wallbang though every surface with pistol calibre weapons, they are immune to stingers/flashes 60% of the time, they can see through exterior glass (you can't), if you don't wedge every door on the map they start roaming at the first sound of intrusion, they can pixel peak. Every suspect will get back up at least once, most will twice and pull arsenals out their arse. And worst of all, every suspect whether battle-hardened vet or scared teens fucking up a gas station robbery will have the morale of the most suicidal jihadi on earth

Squad AI are simultaneously smarter and yet tarded, they have better execution of commands. If they want to follow them, often they stand still frozen. Don't trust them to throw a nade in a room in a competent way, if the room is a corridor and you're attacking it on the long side, that nade will be thrown straight ahead instead of down the corridor affecting 0 people. If you're attempting the hell known as the non lethal run, don't give them shotguns as they will just kill people but then again they'll magdump with the pepperball, miss 75% of the shots, let the suspect run away, leave 1 ball in the magazine, start the next fight and get killed when they THEN have to reload.
They are fucking DETERMINED to path through wherever you're stood, there could be a gap the size of the Titanic, but if you are in front of that straight line they chose get used to hearing that you're in their spot. 

The fact that every map is meant to be tied into a greater narrative is detrimental, the new streamer map was teased as a tutorial mission to not go in guns blazing as it turns out to be a swatting incident and nothing more. But now this streamer has his own deathly loyal private army and it's turned into a siege like every other map all because every mission must have 5+ bad guys. 

The games lighting feels off, idk how to describe it.

Multiple entry points are bugged on Ides of March (fire exit only)

Launchers are bugged, if you equip your team with team with them, they can only be used once (not per launcher equipped, ONCE)

Evidence often clips through the floor

Traps are sometimes invisible due to clipping

Reflections are bugged

Whether you can disarm traps is a lottery, you have to be stood at the perfect angle to get the multi-tool prompt (even slightly touch the door and you die)

I haven't seen the advertised trailers units ONCE

Customisation is disappointingly limited, but nice its been included

Most gun descriptions don't list the calibre (I guess this is obvious to most, me included, but I feel it should be listed)



And to top all this off:     Void have gone quiet again, the biweekly dev blog has gone quiet as of posting, but their socials happily share their discord or positive reviews

Before the "1.0 Update" dropped, Ready or Not was a fun -if incomplete- game.

Now Ready or Not is unplayable, and not for performance issues either, though performance has certainly taken a hit. The AI used to be difficult, but now they are impossible.  X-Ray vision, laserlike accuracy, supernatural hearing, these AI have all that and more. Don't take my word for it, there are multiple Youtube videos showing that these devs have failed to grasp decade-old facets of AI programming. 

 Play this game now at your own risk, and certainly don't buy it until it's been patched more than the stalls of a truck-stop bathroom.

Its good, hell its great even, but there needs to be a few QOL improvements to keep me from losing my mind. The weapon selection screen is a little wonky, especially with your AI team, I would recommend a few simple buttons like a "copy loadout" to make your team more effective, as going through each team mate is a little tedious. SWAT 4 had a prefect formula that I think you should look into. Also the weapon select screen is still buggy, I spent half an hour customizing my team for a non lethal run only to realize that when you switch loadouts they sometimes copy the team lead and remove your progress. Other than that, I love the customization and campaign from version 1.0. I dare say with these tweaks 'Ready or not' will finally be ready for mass appeal.

Enemy AI need a bit of work but the game is awesome in every other aspect.

After full release and more hours playing, still good but with issues
AI - Friendly AI has 0 self preservation and will not restrain enemies at times when clearing a room resulting in them getting shot in the back or you getting gunned down. 
Enemy AI is cracked as all fuck. The low level gas station robbing punk has the accuracy of a 20 year marine vet.
There's also the issue of there's times when you can put 6 rounds in the chest of a guy with no armor on and he'll tank it like a champ but a single shot to you and you'll be flailing around and bleeding out

Quality of life - So you die, mission failed we'll get them next time, but there's no menu to rework your squad and loadout and then hitting restart. Nope, you'll be brought back to the police station hub, have to open your tablet thing, rework your squad for their mental health or if they've died, then still walk to the armory area to change yours/their loadout. Then you still need to go back to the desk, pick the mission you failed and then retry. On missions where you are getting your ass handed to you thanks to the AI this gets beyond annoying and tedious.

Performance - Im running on a 3060, and there's occasional frame drops, running the game on directx 12 does help but there are still dips.

Bugs - main bug ive noticed is the skinning of the characters, so a lot NPCs will have their skin clip through their clothing when arresting them.
Otherwise its minor things like telling your AI to block the door and they stare at you like what do you mean?

Game is good but needs some balancing - there are mods you can download with integrated mod support (which is great) but it shouldnt fall to the modding community to fix things like AI balancing 

Side note - You cant see the stats of weapons so you literally have to go through the process of playing a level with a gun to figure out of its any good or not

Let's start with the positives. The graphics in Ready or Not are undeniably top-notch, delivering realistic environments that contribute significantly to the game's overall immersion. The downside is that the AI is garbage, you keep getting 360 no-scoped by a pistol when you peak a wall for not even a second.

Love the idea of the game but I have to agree with the people being rubbed the wrong way from updates being released weeks earlier only for "supporters" of the game who were suckered out of 80$. Not to mention the devs are pretty terrible at communication recently, like changing the recent update from being available for all players, to being pushed back, only to then be made for supporters first all without a word. Bad business practice.

Edit: Thanks for the support on this review guys. Let's hope the developers see our complaints  and make some sort of positive change. Whether that be more communication and transparency, or a change to the awful "supporter" edition (although I bet they're going to follow the dollar signs on that idea).

Edit 2: The 1.0 version of the game came out and it is a massive disappointment. The AI is absolutely atrocious and one shots you instantly before you can even tell they are a threat just like early access, and the performance is laughable. Id say the game is still "Not Ready".

Start off by saying the game is fun, good shooter, and awesome missions on the maps.. at first. The thing that really messes up the game for me is the AI. The AI is cracked out. The AI tracks you through walls, pre-fires on you before LOS, and takes multiple shots to the chest despite no armor. The slightest LOS makes the AI lose their mind and shoots on sight. No taking cover, no looking ways to flank you. Straight just bum rushes and it feels like you're being hunted by John Wick. At first when you play the game, you don't notice it, until you're getting one shot through windows and you have no idea where the shot came from. It doesn't feel difficult, just unfair how the AI can see you before you see them.

I love this game and its a nice break from the spam cod that's produced every year. If the devs can fix the AI, make them somewhat better, more dynamic such as taking hostages, hiding, or even just flee. I believe this game could do really well. There are mods you can download to fix the AI and it does help a lot. Just make sure you review the game thoroughly before you buy. Know what you're getting into.

This game has evolved from the promising spiritual successor to SWAT 4 into a broken, frustrating, and uninspired, disappointment. If you get the itch for SWAT 4, just go play SWAT 4.

This game has been pretty good for the last couple of years and seeing it develop to a full product has been great. At 1.0 the only real issues many people(including me) have is Mod.IO being the modding platform for this game and the AI being absolutely cracked no matter if they're tweakers or spec ops commandos. This second point can be fixed with mods and while Mod.IO works it's extremely clunky and feature-desolate compared to the Steam Workshop, Thunderstore, or Nexus.

In pretty much every way this game surpasses SWAT 4 in any meaningful metrics it just needs it's AI officially retuned and it will be a solid purchase for anyone in the "hardcore" shooter sphere

With the full release, it's a better, more complete game. When I played it earlier in 2023 during early access, it had some cool pieces but largely felt like an incomplete thought. Now it feels more like a complete thought. There are some minor gripes, but overall this is a solid game if you're going in solo and I would imagine is even more fun with friends.

PROS:
- Commander mode is cool and gives you a sense of progression
- New maps are great and very challenging
- New weapons (always a plus)
- Enemies seem...smarter, more aggressive on certain maps, and less predictable
- More character customization 

CONS:
- The SWAT roster system is a little flat. Losing team members doesn't really mean much
- Frame rate drops on certain missions in certain rooms/areas of the map
- Can't see what rating you got on completed missions
Fun game, mods are good. Only two issues, enemies have aim hacks. And the bomb timer is crazy short.
Pretty sweet game!

Everyone is complaining about the AI, and rightfully so. No idea what drugs the devs are on to think 100ms reaction time from AI is acceptable. There are articles looking through the suspect AI code and, yes, it's literally 100ms if they're alerted. 200ms if they're not. The fact they can sometimes ignore CS gas and see you through it, which is essential to S rank all the missions is also so fun with their aimbot accuracy. Crazy how old women can pick you off from 70m away because they seen a pixel of your body through some boarded window. I could never fathom the reason why 9/10 suspects fake surrender to only pull out something every time you go to cuff them; the devs must have watched video compilations of the craziest criminals for their inspiration.
It should be a crime for devs to make games where AI gun you down in a blink of an eye while you have to yell at them, or suffer the negative "unauthorized use of force" punishment.
How fast these suspects can move in comparison to you is also insane. They can basically run around the level and come strafing across a door, with no gun collision, gunning you down so easily. They can also see you perfectly fine in complete darkness. Not sure if it's incompetency, negligence, or lack of knowledge from the devs to not have zones on the map that lower AI accuracy if they're standing in certain light levels or see a player in those zones.
It makes the game a chore to play. However, mods do alleviate the frustration but at the cost of not counting the score legitimately at the end of missions.

I have no idea why they don't have a difficulty scale based on how many players you have in a party, and the type of suspect they are to stop every suspect feeling like some ex-military solider.

Enough with the bad talk of the game, here's some good stuff:
When the optimization isn't pissing the bed, the game is fun. The level designs, briefing, weapons, uniform customization, and some audio is well done. The non-lethal weapons, pepperspray, and riotshield are underwhelming because of the reasons above but it is a fun challenge to get those nice S ranks.

Regardless of the huge negative of the AI being way overtuned. I do really enjoy this game and what it offers for the most part.

EA player, Its good, the AI will constantly have you on edge as to whether or not its a good idea to poke out your head into the line of fire, or pursue a fleeing suspect who made a good choice to run outside of a room. overall if you can vibe with the slower paced gameplay you should pick it up.

PROS
-customization of character and voice
-Nail-biting slow paced action with hectic firefights
-Extensive weapon customization
-Gorgeous Graphics, animations and sound design
-Fairly optimized for older hardware consistently above 30 fps on a 5500xt
-Fantastic environmental storytelling 
-More content to come
-Mods and Custom content

CONS
-Character customization is exclusive to MP
-AI can be too responsive and you'll die many times without knowing where the enemy is
-Slower paced combat isn't for everyone and you'll be missing a lot of shots in an engagement.
-Shoot house locked behind progression in SP
-Sound design will make you jump once or twice leading to death (especially if you run speakers)
-Most weapons provide little variety (mostly reskins)
-Dev's can take awhile due to their small size
